title: Dedication to the Genius Augusti
support: A section of moulding, composed of off-white marble. Intact at the left end, with a clean cut or break at the right end (both the inscription and moulding are incomplete). The upper edge is rough chiselled, with metal pegs inserted in the top towards each end (8cm from left end, 5 cm from right end). The moulding is made up of four stepped elements, of which the lower (and larger) two carry the inscribed field.

layout.p: Two lines of Latin text incised on the lower two elements of the moulding

handNote.lettering: The letters are simply and crudely cut, displaying considerable irregularity in both height and width. Letters are finished with crude triangular serifs, and interpuncts are triangular in form, heavily cut. V is wide, S is shallow, R and P are closed, C and G are not distinguished.

provenanceFound._: Excavated in 1971, in taberna 7 of the west portico in the agora

provenanceObserved._: On display in the lapidarium on site
